root.name: split()

example.code: String s = "a, b c ,,d "; // Despite the bad formatting, String[] p = splitTokens(s, ", "); // the data is parsed correctly println(p[0]); // Prints "a" println(p[1]); // Prints "b" println(p[2]); // Prints "c" println(p[3]); // Prints "d"

root.description: The splitTokens() function allows you to split a String at one or many character "tokens." The tokens parameter specifies the character or characters that mark the boundaries between each data element. If no tokens character is specified, a whitespace character is used as the split character. Whitespace characters include tab (\t), line feed (\n), carriage return (\r), and form feed (\f), and space. To convert a String to an array of integers or floats, use the datatype conversion functions int() and float() to convert the array of Strings.
